headline: Tesla Stock Falls as EV Sales Plummet. Why Musk Has a Global Headache.
summary: Tesla  has had a tough year.  It has competition problems in China, political problems in Europe, and policy problems in the U.S. Despite all that, the stock has been resilient.  Shares of the electric vehicle maker and artificial-intelligence technology company were down 0.3% in premarket trading at $445.55, while  and  futures were down 0.2% and up 0.2%, respectively.

headline: Analysis-Musk's Mars mission adds risk to red-hot SpaceX IPO
summary: Investors eyeing SpaceX's potential blockbuster IPO may need to brace themselves as CEO Elon Musk balances his risky quest to reach Mars with growing the revenue-rich Starlink satellite broadband business that would offer more reliable shareholder returns.  SpaceX, which transformed space travel with reusable rockets and built a global satellite broadband network, ​is targeting a listing next year that could raise more than $25  billion at a valuation exceeding $1  trillion, which would rank among the largest initial public offerings in history.  Musk has always maintained that sending humans to ‌Mars was his lifelong ambition.

content.title: Analysis-Musk's Mars mission adds risk to red-hot SpaceX IPO
content.summary: Investors eyeing SpaceX's potential blockbuster IPO may need to brace themselves as CEO Elon Musk balances his risky quest to reach Mars with growing the revenue-rich Starlink satellite broadband business that would offer more reliable shareholder returns.  SpaceX, which transformed space travel with reusable rockets and built a global satellite broadband network, ​is targeting a listing next year that could raise more than $25  billion at a valuation exceeding $1  trillion, which would rank among the largest initial public offerings in history.  Musk has always maintained that sending humans to ‌Mars was his lifelong ambition.

headline: Tesla Sales Plummet. The Stock Rises Despite a Global Headache.
summary: Tesla  has had a tough year.  It has competition problems in China, political problems in Europe, and policy problems in the U.S. Despite all that, the stock has been resilient—even after continued signs of slumping sales.  Tesla’s sales in November dropped to a three-year low, Reuters reported after Thursday’s close citing data provider Cox Automotive.

content.title: Tesla Sales Plummet. The Stock Rises Despite a Global Headache.
content.summary: Tesla  has had a tough year.  It has competition problems in China, political problems in Europe, and policy problems in the U.S. Despite all that, the stock has been resilient—even after continued signs of slumping sales.  Tesla’s sales in November dropped to a three-year low, Reuters reported after Thursday’s close citing data provider Cox Automotive.

headline: Mag 7 Stocks Still Dominate, Goldman Says. That Could Change Soon.
summary: Megacap tech stocks are likely to continue dominating the pace and direction of the S&P 500 next year, according to data from Goldman Sachs, even as investors bet on broader participation from companies outside of the cohort as the economy remains surprisingly resilient.  The so-called Magnificent Seven tech stocks, which includes  Tesla  have accounted for around 43% of the S&P 500’s advance into the end of November, based on data from S&P Dow Jones senior index analyst Howard Silverblatt.  Goldman Sachs still sees the biggest tech stocks driving nearly half of  earnings growth next year, but also expects improvements in the contribution from the s0-called “other 493” members of the benchmark.

content.title: Mag 7 Stocks Still Dominate, Goldman Says. That Could Change Soon.

The so-called Magnificent Seven tech stocks, which includes  Tesla  have accounted for around 43% of the S&P 500’s advance into the end of November, based on data from S&P Dow Jones senior index analyst Howard Silverblatt.  Goldman Sachs still sees the biggest tech stocks driving nearly half of  earnings growth next year, but also expects improvements in the contribution from the s0-called “other 493” members of the benchmark.

headline: Autonomous vehicles are driving more aggressively, and maybe that's needed
summary: While Waymo's self-driving cars — which is a subsidiary of Google parent company Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) — are found to be involved in fewer accidents than human drivers in the metro areas it operates in, according to Semafor, the autonomous vehicles appear to be engaging in more aggressive driving in several videos that have gone viral. University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign Associate Director of the Center for Autonomy associate professor Katherine Driggs-Campbell helps break down the behavior shift in Waymo vehicles, whether this is all safer or necessary for autonomous vehicle learning, To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Autonomous vehicles are driving more aggressively, and maybe that's needed
content.description:
While Waymo's self-driving cars — which is a subsidiary of Google parent company Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) — are found to be involved in fewer accidents than human drivers in the metro areas it operates in, according to Semafor, the autonomous vehicles appear to be engaging in more aggressive driving in several videos that have gone viral.

University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign Associate Director of the Center for Autonomy associate professor Katherine Driggs-Campbell helps break down the behavior shift in Waymo vehicles, whether this is all safer or necessary for autonomous vehicle learning,

headline: Rivian Is Now an AI Stock. Is It Finally a Buy?
summary: Rivian Automotive (NASDAQ:RIVN) held its first Autonomy and AI Day conference yesterday, unveiling its inaugural in-house AI chip, the Rivian Autonomy Processor (RAP1). This custom silicon, a 5-nanometer chip with 1,600 sparse TOPS of inference power, marks Rivian’s shift toward vertical integration in autonomous driving tech. It positions the company to compete directly with Nvidia ... Rivian Is Now an AI Stock. Is It Finally a Buy?

headline: How to trade covered call options: Investor playbook
summary: Want to broaden your investor playbook, but don't know how or where to start? Market Domination host Jared Blikre explains a specific segment of the options trade: buying and selling covered calls. Using Tesla (TSLA) stock as a prime example, Jared Blikre outlines the pros and cons of covered call trades, the risks involved, and the premiums investors could end up collecting. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
